remarks: The chain rule for derivatives at a point.  For the (simpler but more limited) function version, see ~ dvco .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 9-Aug-2014.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 28-Dec-2016.)
statement:
dvco.f $e |- ( ph -> F : X --> CC ) $.
dvco.x $e |- ( ph -> X C_ S ) $.
dvco.g $e |- ( ph -> G : Y --> X ) $.
dvco.y $e |- ( ph -> Y C_ T ) $.
dvcobr.s $e |- ( ph -> S C_ CC ) $.
dvcobr.t $e |- ( ph -> T C_ CC ) $.
dvco.k $e |- ( ph -> K e. V ) $.
dvco.l $e |- ( ph -> L e. V ) $.
dvco.bf $e |- ( ph -> ( G ` C ) ( S _D F ) K ) $.
dvco.bg $e |- ( ph -> C ( T _D G ) L ) $.
dvco.j $e |- J = ( TopOpen ` CCfld ) $.
dvcobr $p |- ( ph -> C ( T _D ( F o. G ) ) ( K x. L ) ) $.
